title: Searching for commit id doesnt work
body: When I tried to locate where a branch was, I solo'ed to it. Copied the latest commit id. Cleared the solo (which could be improved), then searched. It didnt navigate to it (it may have highlighted it, but I wasnt going to look)

title: Branch navigation
body:
enhancement

clicking on a branch from either local or remote, should navigate to it in the commit history (git kraken does this)

title: Merge Improvements
body:
enhancement

When merging, I want a what to squash merge. Currently running the terminal to do this still.

title: Git Commit Visiualization Enhancement
body:
enhancement

GitKraken had a ton of options for if you right clicked a branch in the history visualization part (the graphical view). I just tried to merge a branch in from it and could't, I also regularly used delete there.

title: Changing repositories does not change the selected commit details
body:
## Description

When I select a commit in one repository and change, it doesnt reset

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Select leaf repo and pick a commit
2. VIew the details in the right pane
3. Change repositories
4. The details should clear

title: Add all repos from folder
body:
## Description

This is not a permanent link and needs to be re-run

## Expected Behavior

WHen I add a folder, if I later clone a repo I would expect it to show up

## Actual Behavior

Instead, if I clone a repo I have to manually run the command again

title: Staged file bug
body: This doesn't look for changes., So if you have pending changes in git and you are looking at them, but them another process commits / pushes (claude, gitKRaken, etc), it still shows the old commit information

title: staged files panel improvements
body:
These are all things I used in gitkraken / fork regularly 
 
- Need a toggle to swap from path to tree view on the staged files
- Context menu should have a `open file` option
- The header of sections should be collapsible

title: Feature: Integrated Console/Terminal Pane
body:
## Overview
Add an integrated console/terminal pane to Leaf, positioned below the branch history area. This provides direct command-line access and transparency into the git commands executed by the GUI.

## Console Pane Layout

### Position & Behavior
- [ ] **Docked at bottom** - Below branch history/commit details area
- [ ] **Resizable** - Drag handle to adjust height
- [ ] **Collapsible** - Toggle visibility with button/shortcut
- [ ] **Minimum height** - Ensure usable size when expanded
- [ ] **Remember state** - Persist visibility and height between sessions

### Toggle Access
- [ ] **View menu option** - "View > Console" or "View > Terminal"
- [ ] **Keyboard shortcut** - e.g., Ctrl+` (backtick) like VS Code
- [ ] **Toolbar button** - Quick toggle icon
- [ ] **Status bar trigger** - Click area in status bar to reveal

## Full Terminal Emulator

### Shell Support
- [ ] **Windows**: PowerShell (default), CMD, Git Bash, WSL
- [ ] **macOS**: zsh (default), bash
- [ ] **Linux**: User's default shell (bash, zsh, fish, etc.)
- [ ] **Shell selection** - Dropdown to switch or configure default
- [ ] **Working directory** - Automatically set to repository root

### Terminal Features
- [ ] **ANSI color support** - Full color output rendering
- [ ] **Unicode support** - Proper character rendering
- [ ] **Scrollback buffer** - Configurable history length
- [ ] **Clear command** - Clear terminal output
- [ ] **Multiple sessions** - Tabs for multiple terminal instances (optional)

## Input Assistance

### Command Autocomplete
- [ ] **Git command completion** - Suggest git subcommands (commit, push, pull, etc.)
- [ ] **Git flag completion** - Suggest flags (--amend, --force, -m, etc.)
- [ ] **Branch name completion** - Autocomplete branch names from repo
- [ ] **File path completion** - Autocomplete file paths
- [ ] **Remote name completion** - Autocomplete remote names
- [ ] **Dropdown suggestions** - Show completion options as popup
- [ ] **Tab to complete** - Standard tab completion behavior

### Command History
- [ ] **Up/Down navigation** - Cycle through previous commands
- [ ] **Persistent history** - Save history between sessions
- [ ] **Per-repository history** - Separate history per repo (optional)
- [ ] **History search** - Ctrl+R reverse search
- [ ] **History limit** - Configurable max history entries

### Syntax Highlighting
- [ ] **Command highlighting** - Color git commands
- [ ] **Flag highlighting** - Different color for flags/options
- [ ] **String highlighting** - Highlight quoted strings
- [ ] **Path highlighting** - Distinguish file paths
- [ ] **Error highlighting** - Red for invalid syntax (if detectable)

## GUI Command Logging

### Toggle Feature
- [ ] **Master toggle** - Single switch to enable/disable GUI command logging
- [ ] **Toggle in console toolbar** - Easy access button (e.g., "Show GUI Commands")
- [ ] **Visual indicator** - Clear indication when logging is active
- [ ] **Persist preference** - Remember toggle state between sessions

### Logged Information
- [ ] **Full command** - Show exact git command executed
- [ ] **Timestamp** - When command was executed
- [ ] **Trigger source** - What GUI action initiated it (e.g., "Pull button", "Commit dialog")
- [ ] **Exit code** - Success/failure status
- [ ] **Execution time** - How long command took (optional)

### Log Formatting
- [ ] **Distinct styling** - Visually differentiate GUI commands from user commands
- [ ] **Prefix/icon** - e.g., `[GUI]` or ??? icon before GUI commands
- [ ] **Collapsible output** - Expand/collapse verbose output
- [ ] **Error highlighting** - Red/bold for failed commands with full stderr

## Interactive Output Features

### Clickable File Paths
- [ ] **Detect file paths** - Parse paths from git output
- [ ] **Click to open** - Open file in default editor or Leaf's viewer
- [ ] **Right-click menu** - Options: Open, Open folder, Copy path
- [ ] **Hover preview** - Show file preview on hover (optional)

### Clickable Commit Hashes
- [ ] **Detect commit SHAs** - Parse short and full hashes
- [ ] **Click to view** - Open commit details in Leaf
- [ ] **Right-click menu** - Options: View commit, Copy hash, Checkout, Cherry-pick
- [ ] **Hover preview** - Show commit summary on hover

### Clickable Branch Names
- [ ] **Detect branch references** - Parse branch names from output
- [ ] **Click to checkout** - Switch to branch
- [ ] **Right-click menu** - Options: Checkout, View branch, Copy name

## Copy & Export

### Selection & Copy
- [ ] **Text selection** - Click and drag to select output
- [ ] **Keyboard selection** - Shift+arrows for selection
- [ ] **Copy shortcut** - Ctrl+C / Cmd+C to copy selection
- [ ] **Copy without formatting** - Plain text option
- [ ] **Right-click copy** - Context menu copy option

### Export Features
- [ ] **Export session** - Save entire console session to file
- [ ] **Export formats** - Plain text (.txt), with ANSI codes, HTML
- [ ] **Auto-export on close** - Option to save session when closing repo
- [ ] **Export GUI command log** - Separate export for just GUI commands

## Error Handling & Display

### Error Presentation
- [ ] **Stderr highlighting** - Red/distinct color for error output
- [ ] **Error summary** - Collapsible error details
- [ ] **Error notification** - Toast/alert for critical errors
- [ ] **Link to documentation** - Suggest help for common errors (optional)

### Recovery Actions
- [ ] **Retry button** - Quick retry for failed commands
- [ ] **Copy error** - One-click copy error message
- [ ] **Search error** - Search error message online (optional)

## Settings & Configuration

### Console Settings
- [ ] **Default shell** - Choose preferred shell
- [ ] **Font family** - Monospace font selection
- [ ] **Font size** - Adjustable text size
- [ ] **Color scheme** - Light/dark/custom themes
- [ ] **Scrollback lines** - Configure buffer size
- [ ] **Cursor style** - Block, underline, bar

### Behavior Settings
- [ ] **Show on error** - Auto-reveal console when GUI command fails
- [ ] **Auto-scroll** - Toggle auto-scroll on new output
- [ ] **Bell sound** - Enable/disable terminal bell
- [ ] **Focus on reveal** - Auto-focus input when console opens

## Keyboard Shortcuts
- [ ] **Toggle console** - Ctrl+` (configurable)
- [ ] **Clear console** - Ctrl+L
- [ ] **Kill process** - Ctrl+C
- [ ] **New terminal tab** - Ctrl+Shift+T (if tabs supported)
- [ ] **Close terminal tab** - Ctrl+Shift+W
- [ ] **Focus console** - Dedicated shortcut
- [ ] **History search** - Ctrl+R

## Implementation Notes
- Consider using a terminal library like xterm.js for cross-platform terminal emulation
- GUI command logging should have minimal performance impact on normal operations
- Ensure proper process cleanup when closing console or application

title: Feature: Full GitFlow Support Through GUI
body:
## Overview
Implement comprehensive GitFlow workflow support through the Leaf GUI, enabling users to manage the full GitFlow branching model without needing command-line tools.

## Core GitFlow Operations

### Initialization
- [ ] **GitFlow Init wizard** - Initialize GitFlow in a repository with guided setup
- [ ] **Branch detection** - Auto-detect existing GitFlow structure in repositories
- [ ] **Configurable branch prefixes** - Allow customization of all prefixes:
  - Main/master branch name
  - Develop branch name
  - Feature prefix (default: `feature/`)
  - Release prefix (default: `release/`)
  - Hotfix prefix (default: `hotfix/`)
  - Support prefix (default: `support/`)

### Feature Branches
- [ ] **Start feature** - Create new feature branch from develop
- [ ] **Finish feature** - Merge feature back to develop with merge strategy selection
- [ ] **Publish feature** - Push feature branch to remote
- [ ] **Pull feature** - Pull updates from remote feature branch
- [ ] **Delete feature** - Clean up local and remote feature branches

### Release Branches
- [ ] **Start release** - Create release branch from develop with version number
- [ ] **Finish release** - Merge to main AND develop, create version tag
- [ ] **Publish release** - Push release branch to remote
- [ ] **Delete release** - Clean up after release completion

### Hotfix Branches
- [ ] **Start hotfix** - Create hotfix branch from main with version number
- [ ] **Finish hotfix** - Merge to main AND develop, create version tag
- [ ] **Publish hotfix** - Push hotfix branch to remote
- [ ] **Delete hotfix** - Clean up after hotfix completion

## Merge Strategy Options
When finishing any branch, prompt user to select:
- [ ] **Merge commit** - Standard merge (preserves full history)
- [ ] **Squash merge** - Combine all commits into one
- [ ] **Rebase** - Rebase commits onto target branch

## Semantic Versioning Integration
- [ ] **Version detection** - Auto-detect current version from:
  - Git tags
  - `package.json`
  - `.csproj` files
  - Custom version files (configurable)
- [ ] **Version bump suggestions** - Suggest next version based on:
  - Major (breaking changes)
  - Minor (new features)
  - Patch (bug fixes)
- [ ] **Auto-update version files** - Optionally update version in project files when creating release/hotfix
- [ ] **Tag creation** - Automatically create annotated tags with version

## Branch Visualization
- [ ] **GitFlow graph view** - Visual representation of branch structure showing:
  - Main/develop branch lanes
  - Feature/release/hotfix branches
  - Merge points and tags
  - Color-coded by branch type
- [ ] **Branch status indicators** - Show which branches are:
  - Local only
  - Pushed to remote
  - Behind/ahead of base branch
  - In conflict

## Conflict Resolution UI
- [ ] **Merge conflict detection** - Alert when finishing branches will cause conflicts
- [ ] **Side-by-side diff view** - Compare conflicting versions
- [ ] **Three-way merge view** - Show base, ours, theirs
- [ ] **Conflict markers navigation** - Jump between conflicts
- [ ] **Accept theirs/ours/both** - Quick resolution options
- [ ] **Manual edit mode** - Edit merged result directly

## Auto-Push Options
- [ ] **Configurable auto-push** - Settings to automatically push:
  - After starting branches (publish immediately)
  - After finishing branches (push merge results)
  - Tags (push version tags)
- [ ] **Per-operation toggle** - Override default in each operation dialog
- [ ] **Remote selection** - Choose which remote to push to (for multi-remote setups)

## Changelog Generation
- [ ] **Auto-generate changelog** - Create changelog from commits between versions
- [ ] **Conventional commits support** - Parse commit types (feat, fix, docs, etc.)
- [ ] **Changelog format options**:
  - Keep a Changelog format
  - Simple bullet list
  - Grouped by commit type
- [ ] **Edit before save** - Preview and edit generated changelog
- [ ] **Append to CHANGELOG.md** - Automatically update changelog file

## Settings & Configuration
- [ ] **GitFlow settings panel** - Dedicated settings page for:
  - Branch naming conventions
  - Default merge strategies
  - Auto-push preferences
  - Version file locations
  - Changelog preferences
- [ ] **Per-repository config** - Store settings in `.gitflow` or similar
- [ ] **Import/export settings** - Share GitFlow configuration across team

## UI/UX Considerations
- [ ] **GitFlow menu/toolbar** - Quick access to all GitFlow operations
- [ ] **Context menu integration** - Right-click options on branches
- [ ] **Keyboard shortcuts** - Hotkeys for common operations
- [ ] **Operation progress dialogs** - Show progress for multi-step operations
- [ ] **Undo/rollback support** - Ability to undo recent GitFlow operations

## Error Handling
- [ ] **Validation** - Prevent invalid operations (e.g., starting release when one exists)
- [ ] **Clear error messages** - Helpful messages when operations fail
- [ ] **Recovery suggestions** - Guide users to resolve issues

title: UI: 'Select a repository...' text is truncated in branches panel
body:
## Description
The placeholder text in the branches panel that reads "Select a repository to view branches" is being cut off/truncated and does not fit within the allocated area.

## Screenshot
The text appears as "elect a repository to view branche" with the first letter 'S' and last letter 's' being cut off.

## Expected Behavior
The full text "Select a repository to view branches" should be visible within the panel, or the text should be adjusted to fit the available space.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Leaf
2. Do not select any repository
3. Observe the branches panel placeholder text

title: Add installation scripts for unsigned distribution
body:
- Install-Leaf.ps1: Extracts zip and unblocks files to bypass SmartScreen
- Build-Release.ps1: Builds self-contained release and creates distributable zip

Usage:
  1. Run Build-Release.ps1 to create Leaf.zip
  2. Distribute Leaf.zip + Install-Leaf.ps1
  3. Team runs: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File Install-Leaf.ps1
